title: CV
text:
Creative and Artistic Scholarship

Exhibition Catalogues
Dowhaniuk, D. Eds: Porter, E., Ponte, A., Yu, A., Hiemstra, H., Jandrew, S., Jacobs, S. (2025). Manufactured Ecosystems Program Guide and Education Booklet.


Exhibitions Curated
June - August 2025 Manufactured Ecosystems
Co-curator with collaborators Dowhaniuk, D., Ponte, A., Yu, A., Hiemstra, H., Jandrew, S.
Zavitz Gallery, University of Guelph. Guelph, ON.

An immersive exhibition exploring speculative futures at the intersection of art, technology, and nature to address the climate crisis. Served as the public-facing culmination of an international research initiative supported by the Government of Canada’s New Frontiers in Research Fund. Featured interactive installations, speculative prototypes, and imaginative storytelling envisioning how humanity might adapt to ecological collapse through nature-inspired technologies.

title: CV
text:
Teaching

Invited University Lectures - University of Guelph
2024-11, Integrative Vertebrate Biology ZOO 4010, Pathways to Graduate School in Ecology.
2024-10, Advanced Philosophy of the Environment PHIL 4040, Citizen Science as a Way of Knowing.
2022-03, Natural History of the Great Lakes ENVS 1040, Squirrels as a Gateway to Nature Connectedness.


Course Delivery and Training
Jan. 2021 – Apr. 2021: Discovering Biodiversity BIOL 1070, University of Guelph, Guelph ON. Role: Course Co-Coordinator.
Part of the Course Coordination team formed ad hoc when the original course coordinator had to unexpectedly step back.
Mar. 2019 – Apr. 2019: Junior Naturalists Outdoor Education Program, University of Guelph Arboretum, Guelph ON. Role: Outdoor Educator.
After school outdoor education program for children ages 6-12. Developed and led nature-based education programming for the University of Guelph Arboretum.
Jan. 2018 – Jan. 2024: Raptor Husbandry and Behaviour, Wild Ontario, Guelph ON. Role: Team Lead and Trainer.
Primary trainer for 7 trainees. Coordinated training schedules, conducted evaluations, communicated progress to Program Director, and prepared for final evaluations to confirm successful completion and transfer from trainee to Raptor Handler.
Jul. 2013 – Dec. 2016: Lifesaving Society Aquatic Leadership Course Instructor, City of Cambridge, Cambridge, ON. Role: Instructor.
Trained over 50 participants (aged teen to adult) in essential aquatic lifesaving skills, including emergency water rescues and first aid.
Dec. 2011 – Dec. 2016: Canadian Red Cross Aquatic Course Instructor, City of Cambridge, Cambridge, ON. Role: Instructor.


Course Review and Development
Jan. 2025 – Apr. 2025: Course Revision, Humans in the Natural World BIOL 1500
Revision of content and online learning modules to improve relevance and timeliness of course content.
Jan. 2023: Course Revision, Discovering Biodiversity BIOL 1070
Updated experiential learning project (Squirrel Life Project) modules based on student feedback.
Aug. 2022: Course Review, Internship in Biological Science BIOL 3660
Critically reviewed assessment instructions and evaluation criteria and provided recommendations for evidence-based improvement.
Dec. 2021 – Jan. 2022: Course Development, Discovering Biodiversity BIOL 1070
Developed novel, evidence-based experiential learning modules and assessments to deliver core curriculum.
Sep. 2020 – Dec. 2020: Course Revision, Discovering Biodiversity BIOL 1070
Adapted course modules and revised content for virtual delivery during the COVID-19 pandemic.


Teaching Assistantships - University of Guelph
Introduction to One Health, ONEH 1000
(Jan. 2026 - present)
Humans in the Natural World, BIOL 1500
(Sep. - Dec. 2022; Sep. - Dec. 2023; Jan. - Apr. 2025)

(Sep. – Dec. 2020; Jan. – Apr. 2021; Sep. – Dec. 2021; Jan. – Apr. 2023)
Internship in Biological Science, BIOL 3660
(May – Aug. 2022)
Ecology, BIOL 2060
(May – Aug. 2022)


Tutoring
Sep. 2015 - Apr. 2016. Private instruction to undergraduate students to improve academic performance in biology, math, physics, chemistry, biochemistry, and English language skills. Worked with students to identify challenges, set goals, and implement solutions.
